item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
I think the cloud plays a big part in it. However, is the cloud ready for that? I don’t think so and the cost that is needed to put yourself into a cloud infrastructure is in most cases, more expensive than paying for licensing to keep things as they are (think project, consulting, project time, resources…_). Azure isn’t protected from outages completely just like anything else either. We’ve seen that even recently with the outage. Now, for a DR solution on a high volume (size) and even distributed landscape, the cloud is an awesome solution right now. We still have to consider support that Azure doesn’t provide yet and what we have to go through simply to make us Azure ready. Azure is secure but there are a lot of big companies out there that need to take security to a level that the term, “The Cloud” simply freaks them out.

In short, Yes. I think the cloud can provide a solution in some ways to HA but mostly DR in respect to database mirroring. Recent price changes make that even more realistic. We still need growth and maturity in the cloud and SQL Server (IMO). Until then, a lot of the major companies will hesitate.
